channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leafing, 31st October
item.description:
Leaves along chistlehurst road making a slip hazard on the pavement JW
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains all the way along this stretch of the Woolwich road, 31st October
item.description:
The drains are blocked all the way along the Woolwich road where it meets Annandale, Calvert and Chevening. This happens every single time it rains a lot. There's a huge amount of water build up which makes it impossible for pedestrians to walk along the pavements and stay dry. Every time a vehicle goes by, the spray caused by the water buildup covers the entire pavement. Please sort this out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 166, Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is constantly blocked covering a large pothole, 31st October
item.description:
This drain has been blocked for a long time, covering a large deep pothole which is dangerous as the large puddle can not be avoider
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartslock Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken road area /pothole, 31st October
item.description:
There is a drop-down kerb on junction of Solway Road and East Dulwich Road ( Apple tree café side) The tarmac on the road is damaged and there is a hole so that prams have major difficulties navigating over it. The pram wheels got stuck and our pram flipped right over hurting our grandchildren and my wife quite badly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Solway Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti tags sprayed on street boxes along St Martin's Road SW9., 31st October
item.description:
I like to report graffiti tags sprayed on street boxes along the stretch of St Martin's Road SW9. The tags have been there for approximately two months. Please could you remove them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Martin's Road, Stockwell, London

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The tree outside 209 Kings Hall Road needs pollarding, 31st October
item.description:
The tree outside 209 kings Hall Road is becoming a danger to the public. It has been struck by lorries 3 times now because the branches are low and heavy. The tree is now leaning into the road because it hasn’t been cared for. Large branches regularly fall into our property and have narrowly missed our cars. The roots have grown under the drive and cracked our clay drains. Having spoken to 2 tree surgeons they strongly advised that the trees in this section of this road should all be pollarded for their health. They are also so large that they are blocking light from street lamps; in the dark this is a problem because the pavements are so uneven because of the roots. I’m still trying to understand why there is no “tree programme” for these trees and yet the trees in Lennard Road are pruned/pollarded annually.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 large vehicles abondened on the green by cul de sac, 31st October
item.description:
Resident reporting there are 2 large vehicles no MOT or Road Tax one is a ambulance & the other is a large transit lorry they are taking up all the space and no where for residents to park. Both vehicles are SORN 2020 when checked with DVLA. The large transit lorry arrived yesterday it is like a delivery lorry Reg KR14 LLY.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Groombridge Close, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
